results.title: Western wheat
results.creator_credit: Larry Gosnell, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film shows the drama of the wheat harvest played out on millions of western Canadian acres. In late summer great combine harvesters surge into the golden fields, and so begins the flow of a river of grain—from combine to truck, to prairie elevator, to grain cars, to marshalling yards and, finally, to Great Lakes terminal elevators and freighters. Grading and inspection at each stage of transit ensures top-quality export wheat; scientists strive to produce still hardier varieties. The film ends with a sequence on breadmaking in a large bakery.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Larry Gosnell, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada

Grading and inspection at each stage of transit ensures top-quality export wheat; scientists strive to produce still hardier varieties. The film ends with a sequence on breadmaking in a large bakery.

Grading and inspection at each stage of transit ensures top-quality export wheat; scientists strive to produce still hardier varieties. results.title: Vikings: warriors from the sea
results.creator_credit: David Hall, Graham Holloway and Odin Productions
results.brief_description: Filmed in Norway and on the Isle of Man, this documentary uses authentic recreations of Viking Journeys and activities to explain the reality behind the Viking Myths, who they were, where they came from, why they took long sea voyages and why their power terrified the world. It is the story of a local chieftain who is holding a feast to honour a guest to his house. Includes 3D graphics of Viking ship design and footage of the Viking fire festival held in York. Recreations by members of the Karmoy Viking Club.

results.title: Viewpoint on Perth
results.creator_credit: Brian Woods, Curtis Levy, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The city of Perth, Western Australia, as seen through the eyes of European migrants. Commentary is made on the life style in Perth including housing, public transport, shopping facilities, job availability, industries, education and the role of the mining industry in Western Australia.

results.title: Series 4
results.creator_credit: Normand Gregoire, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An allegorical film suggesting the contact of matter and man; the encounter, sometimes obsessive, sometimes glorifying, of the human being and his environment. To develop his theme the film animator uses only photographs, creating varying perspective’s through optical manipulation and changing colour. The effect is bold and provocative.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Normand Gregoire, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Serial Mom
results.creator_credit: John Waters, John Fiedler, Mark Tarlov and Polar Entertainment
results.brief_description: A combination of Mrs Brady and Murphy Brown, Beverly Sutphin (Kathleen Turner) is fiercely protective of her family, she will do anything to ensure their happiness, anything! She’s an active member of the PTA, a devoted wife to her dentist husband and a great housekeeper. She is “Super Mom”. Still waters, however, run deep and beneath the surface lies a multitude of secrets. Mom isn’t all she’s cracked up to be. Her son’s teacher suddenly disappears after recommending therapy for the boy to deal with his obsession for gore. Her daughter’s boyfriend winds up dead after he fails to call her when he said he would. The one of Dad’s patients forgets to floss and pays the ultimate price.

results.title: Serial experiments: Lain. Vol. 04: reset
results.creator_credit: Akihiko Nishiyama, Johei Matsuura, Ryutaro Nakamura, Haruyo Kanesaku, Hiroe Tsukamoto, Yutaka Maseba, Genco and Pioneer LDCE
results.brief_description: Finale of the animated Japanese series, “Lain”; Volume 04 “Reset”, episodes (layers) 11, 12 and 13. Lain is an introverted thirteen year old schoolgirl who is drawn into the world of “The Wired” (a euphemism for the Internet), an alternate reality where minds roam freely unencumbered by their mortal body. Episode 11, “Infornography”: in an increasingly disoriented existence, Lain is perplexed as to whether she exists at all. Episode 12, “Landscape”: realising she is a multiple presence, Lain struggles to comprehend the dark forces that are enabling the Wired to become connected to the real world. Episode 13, “Ego”: “Where is the real me?” asks Lain, in this final instalment of the series. If Lain deletes herself in the Wired, she may fail to exist at all. Conceptually, “Lain” is comparable to the classic definition of cyberpunk - a paranoid moral and psychological parable that centres on the relationships between people and technology.

results.title: Serial experiments: Lain. Vol. 03: deus
results.creator_credit: Akihiko Nishiyama, Johei Matsuura, Ryutaro Nakamura, Haruyo Kanesaku, Hiroe Tsukamoto, Yutaka Maseba, Genco and Pioneer LDCE
results.brief_description: Continuation of the Japanese animated series “Lain”, Volume 03 “Deus”, episodes (layers) 8, 9 and 10. Lain is an introverted thirteen year old schoolgirl who is drawn into the world of “The Wired” (a euphemism for the Internet), an alternate reality where minds roam freely unencumbered by their mortal body. Episode 8, “Rumours in the Wired”: Lain reveals her aggressive alter ego whilst trying to ascertain whether there is a God. Meanwhile, Lain in the real world becomes increasingly frightened and attempts to wrestle control of her life. Episode 9, “Protocol”: in this episode the history of computers that lead to the establishment of the Wired is explained; Lain confronts Taro, suspecting that he is a Knight. Episode 10, “Love”: Lain comes face-to-face with God in the Wired. Conceptually, “Lain” is comparable to the classic definition of cyberpunk - a paranoid moral and psychological parable that centres on the relationships between people and technology.

results.title: Serial experiments: Lain. Vol. 02: knights
results.creator_credit: Akihiko Nishiyama, Johei Matsuura, Ryutaro Nakamura, Haruyo Kanesaku, Hiroe Tsukamoto, Yutaka Maseba, Genco and Pioneer LDCE
results.brief_description: Continuation of the animated Japanese series, “Lain”, Volume 02 “Knights”, episodes (layers) 5, 6 and 7. Lain is an introverted thirteen year old schoolgirl who is drawn into the world of “The Wired” (a euphemism for the Internet), an alternate reality where minds roam freely unencumbered by their mortal body. Episode 5, “Distortion”: Lain receives communication from mysterious forces about the workings of the Wired, intensifying her powers within the cyber network. As her life becomes progressively stranger, Lain starts to question the bounds of reality as her sister is beset by visions and warnings to fulfil a mysterious prophecy. Episode 6, “Kids”: Lain discovers that a rash of teen suicides is connected to a game played in the Wired. Inured to the world of the Wired, Lain is increasingly isolated from the real world. Episode 7 “Society”: when Lain’s existence is threatened by the ‘Knights’, she enlists the help of the men in black who have been trailing her. Conceptually, “Lain” is comparable to the classic definition of cyberpunk - a paranoid moral and psychological parable that centres on the relationships between people and technology.

results.title: Winning is everything?
results.brief_description: Looks at the intense pressure placed by parents, teachers and coaches on young children in competitive sporting events, at the high drop-out rates in all sports, and at the need to emphasise enjoyment and basic skills acquisition as a foundation for recreation in later life. Suitable for tertiary level.

Suitable for tertiary level.

results.title: Winnie the Pooh discovers the seasons
results.creator_credit: Ennis McNutty, Rick Reinert and Walt Disney
results.brief_description: Christopher Robin gives Winnie the Pooh a calendar to keep track of days and seasons. Winnie and his friends discover the joys of long, warm days and Winnie learns about hibernation from the Wise Owl. With songs and music.
